What: The site checks whether it's being loaded inside another webpage (like an iframe) or if it's the main page you're visiting.
Why: This helps them understand the context of how their page is being accessed.

What: The site reads small text files stored on your device to identify you when you return.
Why: These cookies help remember your preferences and track your visits.

What: The site tracks any errors that occur while you're browsing to improve their service and identify potential issues.
Why: This helps them maintain a smooth user experience.

What: The site tracks whether their webpage is currently visible on your screen or hidden behind other windows/tabs.
Why: This information helps them understand user engagement and optimize content delivery.
